Stone itself which I had sent him (see the fig. in <u>Tab.<\u>). In order to know 
whether there was not another stone, I drew 
the <s>Probe <\s> Catheter a little back <s>by<\s> turning it to the 
Right, which was done without any difficulty <s>pain<\s>
and having pushed it in again I met with 
another Branch of the same Stone, which I 
took for a stone different from the former, and 
concluded then that I had found several Stones 
in the Patient’s <s>Patients <\s> Bladder, and that the <s>[text?]<\s> bad Symptoms
which appeared should continue any longer,
there was no probability of his recovering.
Accordingly the <s>Sobbing <\s>Hiccup coming upon him on the 
20th and the other Symptoms not discontinuing,
he died on the 28th. The Stone was taken out 
four hours after his death, in the presence of 
M. Granet the Curate, M. Casari a Burgher 
of this Town, and <s>of<\s> two of my apPrentices.
The extraordinary figure of this Stone 
will be of no great use for practical Surgery;
but it may furnish matter of much reasoning 
for Philosophers, to know, how it could be formed 
in the Bladder, and yet <s>the Patient did <\s> not be 
troublesome to the Patient for <s>a<\s> so long a time;
what it may be that has given it so particular
